---
title: "Part 2: Loading Data"
subtitle: "Lab 1: Descriptive Statistics"
format: html
filters:
  - webr
webr:
  packages: ['readr']
  show-startup-message: false
---


::: {.cell}

:::


```{webr-r}
#| context: setup
#| warning: false
#| message: false
library(readr)
data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LittleMonkeyLab/datarepo/main/Y1_Week13_Lab1_grit_data.csv"
data <- read_csv(data_url, show_col_types = FALSE)
```

## Watch the Demo

Follow along with the slides below.

```{=html}
<iframe src="part2-slides.html" width="100%" height="500px" style="border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 8px;"></iframe>
```

::: {.callout-tip}
## Tip
Click inside the slide area first, then use arrow keys to navigate.
:::

---

## Try It Yourself

::: {.callout-tip}
## How to Practice
1. **Run the code** by clicking the "Run Code" button
2. **Edit the code** - try different functions
3. **Copy to RStudio** - practice the same code in RStudio Server
:::

### Load the Package

First, load the `readr` package:

```{webr-r}
# The library is pre-loaded, but in RStudio you'd run:
# library(readr)
cat("readr package ready!")
```

### Load Data from GitHub

The data is pre-loaded in these exercises. In RStudio, you'd use:

```{webr-r}
# Data is pre-loaded - in RStudio you'd run:
# data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/..."
# data <- read_csv(data_url)

# Check it's ready
cat("Data loaded successfully!")
cat("\nRows:", nrow(data), "  Columns:", ncol(data))
```

### Inspect with head()

View the first 6 rows:

```{webr-r}
head(data)
```

::: {.callout-note}
## Challenge
Try `head(data, 10)` to see the first 10 rows instead of 6.
:::

### Inspect with str()

Check the structure:

```{webr-r}
str(data)
```

### Check Dimensions

How many rows and columns?

```{webr-r}
dim(data)
```

### Access a Column

Use `$` to get a specific column:

```{webr-r}
# Get the Study_Year column
data$Study_Year
```

::: {.callout-note}
## Challenge
Try accessing `data$G1` to see the first Grit Scale item scores.
:::

---

## Self-Assessment

Check your understanding before moving on.

::: {.webex-check .webex-box}

**1. What function loads a CSV file from the readr package?**

<select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value=''>load_csv()</option><option value=''>import_csv()</option><option value='answer'>read_csv()</option><option value=''>get_csv()</option></select>

**2. What function shows the first few rows of data?**

<select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value=''>first()</option><option value=''>top()</option><option value=''>preview()</option><option value='answer'>head()</option></select>

**3. The function to check data structure is <input class='webex-solveme nospaces' size='3' data-answer='["str"]'/>().**

**4. True or False: You must load a package with `library()` before using its functions.**

<select class='webex-select'><option value='blank'></option><option value='answer'>TRUE</option><option value=''>FALSE</option></select>

**5. To access a column called "score" from data called "df", you write: df<input class='webex-solveme nospaces' size='1' data-answer='["$"]'/>score**

:::
